issues.description: The problem statement refers to the person's date-of-birth field as `dob` (line 3), but the code (both template and solution) uses the field name `birthday` (Person.java). This name mismatch between problem text and code can confuse students (e.g., when searching the codebase for `dob` or when reading the API description) and may lead them to look for a non-existent attribute.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the terminology consistent: update the problem statement to refer to the field as `birthday` (or rename the code field to `dob`) and ensure examples/tests in the description use the same name. Prefer updating the problem text to `birthday` to match existing code and tests.

issues.description: The problem statement's Part 4 description instructs students to call `save(..)` from `personDAO` (lines 100-106), but the template/service code provides and uses a `PersonRepository` field (`personRepository`) in PersonService. The identifier `personDAO` does not exist in the provided template, which may confuse students about which field to use when implementing the service methods.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify the naming in the problem statement: replace references to `personDAO` with `personRepository` (or explicitly state that the DAO is provided as a Spring Data `PersonRepository`) so students can directly use the provided field in PersonService.

issues.description: The problem statement refers to the person's date-of-birth using the identifier `dob` (problem_statement.md line 3), but both the template and solution Person entity use the field name `birthday` (Person.java, field and getters/setters). This creates a naming mismatch for the same conceptual attribute (date of birth) and may cause students to look for `dob` in the code or tests and not find it, adding unnecessary mapping effort.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the name used for the date-of-birth concept. Recommended: update the problem statement to refer to the attribute as `birthday` (matching Person.getBirthday()/setBirthday in code) or explicitly state that `dob` maps to the Person.birthday field (e.g., "attributes such as firstName, lastName, and birthday (aka dob)"). This keeps code and text consistent and reduces student confusion.

issues.description: The problem statement refers to the persistence layer as `PersonDAO` (problem_statement.md line 24), whereas the template and solution use the Spring Data pattern `PersonRepository` (PersonRepository.java). This inconsistent identifier for the same persistence concept may confuse students about which class/interface they should use or modify.
issues.suggested_fix: Replace `PersonDAO` with `PersonRepository` in the problem statement (or explicitly note that the persistence layer is implemented as a Spring Data repository named `PersonRepository`). This aligns terminology with the provided code and avoids small, avoidable confusion for students.
